title: About to do open heart surgery on my new laptop. Could use some guidance.
description: I wanted to do this once. Researched myself into a hate hole and gave up.

title: All the major Bing Chat and AI announcements from Microsoft Build 2023
description: And just to mix it up a little ... here's some more AI news.

title: Bill Gates says A.I. could kill Google Search and Amazon as we know them
description: If ChatGPT can automatically append "-quora" on to every Google search I make, I may think of switching.

title: Built-in ChatGPT-driven Copilot will transform Windows 11 starting in June
Gboard might become easier to resize and reposition on Android
description: Gboard is likely one of the, if not the best, software keyboards for Android out there, with Google having slowly turned it into a true juggernaut of productive and accurate typing. The company now appears to be working on making some customization options easier to find and use. You might soon be able to resize and reposition the keyboard on the fly, allowing you to adjust your preferred button size and position without having to head into the keyboard settings.

title: How to remove scratches from your phone
description: Whether it's from the car keys in your pocket or an accidental drop, our phones are bound to be victims of scratches and scuffs. The best (and safest!) way to fix your scratched and scuffed-up iPhone, Android phone, or other mobile device is to replace the screen!

title: Millions of Android devices are infected with malware before they leave the factory
description: At Black Hat Asia, a team of Trend Micro security researchers claimed that millions of Android devices are infected with malware before they leave the factories.

title: Physicists Create Biggest-Ever Schrödinger’s Cat
description: I feel both smarter, and dumber having just read the referenced material

title: Researchers discover smartphone hack that doesn’t require malware
description: How phones are usually hacked is when the user downloads a piece of malware that then gives the hacker remote access to the device. This requires a bit of effort to convince the target to download said malware. But now it looks like there is a newly-discovered hack, called “GhostTouch”, that will not need malware at all for it to work.

title: Sent WhatsApp messages can now be edited
description: Made a typo or mistake in a WhatsApp message you sent? We’ve all done that. The good news is that instead of deleting the message or sending a second message containing the right words or information, WhatsApp is finally allowing users to edit sent messages as long as it is done within a 15 minute window.

title: Weird AliExpress laptop with Intel 8088 CPU will take you back to the MS-DOS era
description: Because I'm nostalgic for the days when I would spend hours trying to figure out why the computer wouldn't start only to discover the battery powering the clock was dead. Y'see, without that clock, the computer wouldn't boot.
